intro: Ribes huancabambense, commonly known as Huancabamba gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Grossulariaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of Peru and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to orange berries that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
